content.prompt: Which of the following accurately compares interest groups and social movements?

choices.label: Interest groups are organized to advocate for a specific policy issue, whereas social movements advocate for broad social change.
Interest groups only function in a pluralist system, whereas social movements only function in a corporatist system.
Interest groups are more effective in an authoritarian state, whereas social movements are more effective in a democratic state.
Interest groups have more access to the policy-making process in a unitary state, whereas social movements have more access in a federal system.
